title: A History of the Great Trains.pdf
description:
A History of the Great Trains
Harcourt Brace Jovanovich | 1977 | ISBN 0151409307 | Eng | 152 pages | PDF | 53 MB

A History of the Great Trains celebrates the Age of Steam - an age in which huge locomotives battled one another for new speed records, in which such fabled cities as Vladivostock and Constantinople were brought within everyday reach, in which whole continents were opened up, new industrial centers created, new holiday resorts made fashionable, new fortunes built, and a social revolution forged. A History of the Great Trains is a lively and bountifully illustrated book that tells the story of these railroads in Europe and America, in Asia and Australia. Often the construction of the railway lines was itself an epic labor, as engineers and armies of workmen pushed their way across deserts and mountains, over terrain uncharted and unknown
